criteria_descriptions.PVS1: Null variant in a gene where LOF is a known mechanism of disease
criteria_descriptions.PS1: Same amino acid change as a previously established pathogenic variant
criteria_descriptions.PS2: De novo variant in a patient with the disease and no family history
criteria_descriptions.PS3: Well-established functional studies show a deleterious effect
criteria_descriptions.PS4: Prevalence in affected individuals significantly increased compared to controls
criteria_descriptions.PM1: Located in a mutational hot spot or critical functional domain
criteria_descriptions.PM2: Absent from controls or at extremely low frequency
criteria_descriptions.PM3: For recessive disorders, detected in trans with a pathogenic variant
criteria_descriptions.PM4: Protein length changes due to in-frame deletions/insertions or stop-loss variants
criteria_descriptions.PM5: Novel missense change at an amino acid residue where a different pathogenic missense variant has been seen
criteria_descriptions.PM6: Assumed de novo, but without confirmation of paternity and maternity
criteria_descriptions.PP1: Co-segregation with disease in multiple affected family members
criteria_descriptions.PP2: Missense variant in a gene with a low rate of benign missense variants and common pathogenic missense variants
criteria_descriptions.PP3: Multiple lines of computational evidence support a deleterious effect
criteria_descriptions.PP4: Patient's phenotype or family history is highly specific for a disease with a single genetic etiology
criteria_descriptions.PP5: Reputable source recently reports variant as pathogenic
criteria_descriptions.BA1: Allele frequency is > 5% in population databases
criteria_descriptions.BS1: Allele frequency is greater than expected for disorder
criteria_descriptions.BS2: Observed in healthy adult with full penetrance expected at an early age
criteria_descriptions.BS3: Well-established functional studies show no deleterious effect
criteria_descriptions.BS4: Lack of segregation in affected members of a family
criteria_descriptions.BP1: Missense variant in a gene for which primarily truncating variants are known to cause disease
criteria_descriptions.BP2: Observed in trans with a pathogenic variant for a fully penetrant dominant gene/disorder or in cis with a pathogenic variant
criteria_descriptions.BP3: In-frame deletions/insertions in a repetitive region without a known function
criteria_descriptions.BP4: Multiple lines of computational evidence suggest no impact on gene or gene product
criteria_descriptions.BP5: Variant found in a case with an alternate molecular basis for disease
criteria_descriptions.BP6: Reputable source recently reports variant as benign
criteria_descriptions.BP7: A synonymous variant for which splicing prediction algorithms predict no impact
